intro: Aureolaria pedicularia var. austromontana, commonly known as the Australian stormpetal, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal regions. This variety is noted for its hardy nature and ability to withstand drought conditions.
